description: A long fictional story, often with a complex plot and many characters.
A style or category of art, music, or literature.
A person who writes books or stories.
The voice that tells the story in a book.
The main character in a story, often a hero or heroine.
A character who opposes the main character, creating conflict.
Stories that are imaginary or not true.
A detailed description of a person's life.
The most exciting or important part of a story.
A short section at the end of a book that concludes the story.
Hints or clues about what will happen later in a story.
A figure of speech comparing two unlike things without using 'like' or 'as'.
A way of criticizing people or ideas in a humorous way.
A brief summary of the main points of a story or book.
A series of three books, movies, etc., that are closely related.
A wicked or evil character in a story.
A story with characters and events that symbolize ideas about human life.
A factual written account of important or historical events.
The conversations between characters in a book, movie, or play.
A long poem or story about heroic deeds.
A short novel or long short story.
A humorous imitation of a serious piece of literature or writing.
A book, movie, etc., that continues the story of a previous work.
The main subject that is being discussed or described in a piece of writing.
An imagined place in which everything is perfect.
